problem_summary_simple: Check if a string of digits can be split into descending consecutive numbers.
problem_summary_technical: Use backtracking to explore all possible splits, ensuring each subsequent number is one less than the previous.
key_insights: This problem is a classic candidate for backtracking.
The state for the recursion needs to include the current index in the string, the value of the previously chosen number, and the count of numbers found so far.
The base case is when the end of the string is reached, and we check if at least two numbers were formed.
Care must be taken with leading zeros when parsing substrings into numbers.
